page.title: 02DINSDALE VILLAGE
page.content:
Dinsdale is a village which looks the same today as it must have looked centuries ago, the only difference being a through tarmac road, instead of an extension of the Roman Road.
Stone built houses and farm houses of varying sizes and age stand round the village church and Manor House in the style of an ancient settlement.
There is no shop, telephone box or bus service, and the children are taken to school at the nearby village of Hurworth by transport provided by Durham County Council.
This is a truly rural and close knit community.
